title.narrative: Documentation and Assessment of Damage to the 6th-Century Kuelap Archaeological Sites Following the April 2022 Landslide

description.narrative: In April 2022, a section of defensive wall at Kuelap archaeological site collapsed, causing serious damage to one of Perus most important cultural heritage sites. This project involves a conditions survey and hydrological study to support the restoration of the collapsed section and identify other vulnerable features and areas of the site.

title.narrative: Integrated Services for Human Trafficking Victims in Peru

description.narrative: CHS is enhancing victim protection, raising awareness of human trafficking, and conducting multi-disciplinary and multi-sectoral trainings on victim-centered investigations and prosecutions of trafficking cases in Peru. CHS is assisting victims of trafficking through comprehensive services in eight regions in Peru; developing victim protection protocols and procedures; strengthening six victim assistance service centers; and providing technical assistance and training to victim service providers and justice system personnel. CHS is conducting an intensive public awareness campaign, with target audiences to include government officials and media personnel.

title.narrative: Documentation of Colonial Period Paintings and Other Objects in the Collection of the Monastery of Santa Teresa in Ayacucho

description.narrative: The Monastery of Santa Teresa in Ayacucho preserves 700 objects in its collection, including colonial-era paintings, sculptures, textiles, and popular 19th-century art. This project involves the inventory and cataloging of the collection, the evelopment of a risk management plan, and collection storage upgrades.

title.narrative: Preventive Conservation of Ancient Paracas Textiles and Other Pre-Hispanic Andean Objects in Ica

description.narrative: To support the preventive conservation of ancient Paracas textiles, archaeological objects, ceramics, and other Pre-Hispanic Andean objects from 800 to 100 BC. Paracas textiles are among the finest in the world and renowned for their technique and iconography. This project includes the cataloging, photo documentation, and registration of objects and the conservation of a small number of textiles deemed at greatest risk of deterioration.

description.narrative: U.S. Department of State: Bureau of Near Eastern Affairs. GENERAL SERVICES[Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.]
